item.title: Request for new tree in empty tree pit, 2nd July
item.description:
We had a tree removed outside of our house nearly a year ago by the council, and now there is an empty tree pit. All of the other tree pits on our road and the neighbouring roads have had new trees planted in them since then, but ours seems to have been missed. We would like to have a new tree planted in the pit, as we really miss having a tree there. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Marlings Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead decaying fox in bush, 2nd July
item.description:
There is a dead and decaying fox in the large bush in the communal garden between the Brockley Way end block and the road on the Brenchley Gardens estate. It is hidden in the bush, it really smells and there are lots of fly's around. I think it must have been there for a while.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 161-191, Brenchley Gardens, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 84 shoot up hill, 2nd July
item.description:
Significant potholes and dips as a result of bad asphalt. Heavy trucks and buses dip in these and make noise as well as shake the foundation of nearby houses on the Camden council side. I have a crack in the bathroom wall because vibrations are so strong and sometimes I wake up fearing the walls will collapse. The problem was reported several times and completely ignored.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoot-Up Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown and getting worse, 2nd July
item.description:
Making this report as the greenspace here is serious unkempt. The nettles are over 6ft tall proving to be obstacles and barriers for walkers, even my dog won't go through. There are numerous weeds causing problems. The water streams are inundated with litter, tyre, trolleys, bicycles, and rubbish. The paths are littered i.e. food packaging, wine bottles, and actual food. The cow parsley had gone insane and caused problems. The rivers by the other side has an oily scum which is harming wildlife due to the litter and fallen debris that's starting to rot. Im aware of the "rewilding" projects but that's an excuse to not carry out maintenance. Some areas of the park are now inaccessible, the river smells because of pollutants and dead fish. The birds have stopping coming to the stream because of the filth. Its disgusting, overgrown, harmful (as overgrowth encourages tick populations which are bad for dogs). It remains unkempt and as such people are abusing it. If it was kept nice, trim, and looked after, people may think twice before littering, causing damage, and killing wildlife. This park is disgusting and whilst I could come here and sort it out, I shouldn't have to as I pay my council tax that should pay for these services. The bridge still hasn't been repaired after 4 months neither.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
